sub_title: Lecturer at the Amsterdam university of applied sciences
summary:
Extravert personality, who uses his sense of humor to connect with people. 
Achieves sterling results in communicating complex subjects in plain business language and obtains this way cooperation from different stakeholders in an Organization. Builts that way interdepartemental relations and exchanges information on the intersection of marketing, operations and finance processes.

Specialist in analysing existing and quantifying new business concepts for Airlines, Airports and Passenger train organizations. Extensive knowledge in scheduling,forecasting network & time table development. E-distribution and pricing & revenue management. 

Has reported at board-level of big and medium sized companies and has extensive management, project, coaching and international working experience.

profile_positions.title: Lecturer at the University of applied sciences Amsterdam

profile_positions.description:
Clients and projects:
2017
Network and scheduling consultant for Aigle-Azur a regionalFrench carrier operating from Paris. On request of the CEO analysing present network and formulate alternatives for future network development. 
2016
Distributionpecialist for the Twynstra Gudde consultancy firm for the project of future ticketing and distribution for international regional train operators
systems for the train operations in Limburg and the Euregion with Belgium and Germany.
2016
Creating a business case for the feasibility of operating a long distance bus network on behalf of the commercial director for the board of a passenger transportation company.
2015
Forecast trafficstreams for the regional bus operations for county Flevoland on behalf of the public transportation department of Flevoland.
2013
Support the sales and marketing director of HKX in the use and implementation of a software system for distribution, reservation and pricing. HKX is the first independent train operator in Germany and operates between Cologne and Hamburg.
2012
Consult Reed Exhibitions in the USA on the feasibility of applying Revenue Management within the convention industry. This led to the purchase of a "proof of concept" by Reed with a value of 1,5 Mln US$ and an implementation project.
profile_positions.title: Independent Business Consultant for Aviation & Rail business case projects

profile_positions.description:
Sqills is a Software as a Service company where I represent the products: pricing, revenue management, reservation and booking systems for passenger transport organisations.
 
Consult (potential) customers how to improve their bottom line when implementing the Sqills software and I act as project manager for small implementations of the software suite.

Customers in portfolio of Sqills: Reed Exhibitions in the US, MSM and HKX trains in Germany, NS International, Arriva, Syntus in the Netherlands, Irish Rail.
profile_positions.title: Executive Business Consultant and project manager for information systems

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to the board of directors of NS International/NS Hispeed to decide if and how to implement Revenue Management (RM) for the planned high speed train operation. Two major achievements:  

Investigation of the feasibility of Revenue Management for NS Hispeed. This led in 2008 to the abolishing of this option for the domestic operation. In addition of this as from 2009 I managed together with the Belgian Railways to agree on a RM organisation, working procedures, Pricing portfolio and RM system specifications for the future international operation.   

Revise the business case and revenue plan for concession period of the high speed train in cooperation with the consultancy firm OC&C both for the International and Domestic markets. This resulted in 2010 in a major downward revision of the expected revenue for the whole concession period.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager for Revenue Management

profile_positions.description:
Member of the commercial management team, reporting to the chief commercial officer. Four direct reports and output responsible for an additional 8 FTE’s. Responsibilities and achievements for this period:  

Managed the correct data and on time loading of conditions and price levels in all the distribution systems used for the different portfolios of international train tickets sold by NS International (a.o. Benelux, Eurostar, ICE and Thalys).  

Negotiate price levels and conditions for allotments and prorates on third party train operators. Revenue and traffic forecasting for all the international train products sold or operated by NS International.
profile_positions.title: Director of Pricing and the Distribution & Information department

profile_positions.description:
The Malév network consisted out of 32 planes and 45 destinations. Reporting to the commercial director and CEO. In charge of the fleet and scheduling department with ten direct reports. 

Achievements:  Managed an increase of 28% in the number of short connections for Malév at Budapest airport with the same number of aircraft.  

Took the initiative for starting an annual business planning cycle in cooperation with the sales and revenue management department. This was later transformed in a rolling forecast.  

Started the transition from hand to automated systems for fleet planning, slot management and network analysis for markets and competition.
profile_positions.title: Director of Scheduling, Network Development & Revenue Forecast

profile_positions.description:
I reported directly to the CEO and was in charge of a department with an annual budget impact of 4.5 million Gbp. and 16 FTE’s of whom 6 were direct reports. I achieved the following:

Managed the Design of both the low cost and feeder networks. For the latter this included the revenue forecast as well. Fleet utilisation increased for the low cost aircraft with 1:20 hr per unit.

Managed the implementation of an agreed scheduling program for both the internal and external planning and distribution systems. Produce and distribute the rosters for all crew members 410 pilots and 490 ca's.

Negotiating the “slots” (allocated time of landing or departure of an airport) of the airline network.

Implementing the concept of computer aided scenario planning and network analysis. Managed the introduction of Fleet & Crew planning and optimisation software in the workflow.
profile_positions.title: Director of Planning & Production
